text: Barylestis is a genus of huntsman spiders that was first described by Eugène Louis Simon in 1910. ==Species== it contains eleven species, all found in Africa, except B. saaristoi, from Thailand and Myanmar: *Barylestis blaisei (Simon, 1903) (type) – Gabon *Barylestis fagei (Lessert, 1929) – Congo, Rwanda *Barylestis insularis Simon, 1910 – Equatorial Guinea (Bioko) *Barylestis manni (Strand, 1906) – Nigeria *Barylestis montandoni (Lessert, 1929) – Congo, Uganda *Barylestis nigripectus Simon, 1910 – Congo *Barylestis occidentalis (Simon, 1887) – Congo, Uganda, Sudan *Barylestis peltatus (Strand, 1916) – Central Africa *Barylestis saaristoi Jäger, 2008 – China, Thailand, Myanmar *Barylestis scutatus (Pocock, 1903) – Cameroon *Barylestis variatus (Pocock, 1900) – West Africa. Introduced to Northern Ireland, Britain, Belgium, Netherlands, Germany, Czech Rep. ==See also== * List of Sparassidae species ==References== Category:Araneomorphae genera Category:Sparassidae Category:Spiders of Africa Category:Spiders of Asia
title: Barylestis
